page.title: 20Haywood - other facts
page.content: There are many other points of interest in the area. There is a Moat at Colwich which is said to have been a Roman Fort. It links with the path that is evident at Moreton House Farm. Local farmers call Coley Lane "Lonely Lane", some say because it was so lonely to walk along to school. Others say its name come from the Gypsies who lived there once. There are numerous Marl Pits locally. What the Marl was used for is the topic of much debate. The children of Anson School are indebted to the local people for the response they have received. Many people have contributed facts and thoughts, but special thanks must go to The Meakin family at Far Coley Farm, and the Tabernor family of Moreton House Farm, Moreton Barn Farm and formerly of Moreton Farm. We spent hours with them.
